<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 276, 324, 293]]<|/det|>
## FURTHER MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 276, 905, 292]]<|/det|>
9231/13  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 300, 368, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 1 Further Pure Mathematics 1  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[782, 301, 905, 316]]<|/det|>
May/June 2021  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[841, 325, 905, 341]]<|/det|>
2 hours  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 393, 371]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 393, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 230, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 275, 450]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 450, 760, 466]]<|/det|>
Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 466, 806, 482]]<|/det|>
Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 482, 562, 497]]<|/det|>
Write your answer to each question in the space provided.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 498, 485, 512]]<|/det|>
Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 513, 359, 527]]<|/det|>
Do not write on any bar codes.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 528, 868, 559]]<|/det|>
If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 560, 480, 575]]<|/det|>
You should use a calculator where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 575, 880, 606]]<|/det|>
You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 606, 860, 637]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 666, 220, 680]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 682, 384, 697]]<|/det|>
The total mark for this paper is 75.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 698, 730, 713]]<|/det|>
The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 75, 92, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 75, 740, 96]]<|/det|>
The cubic equation \(2x^{3} - 4x^{2} + 3 = 0\) has roots \(\alpha , \beta , \gamma\) . Let \(S_{n} = \alpha^{n} + \beta^{n} + \gamma^{n}\) .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 107, 144, 126]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 107, 515, 126]]<|/det|>
State the value of \(S_{1}\) and find the value of \(S_{2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 107, 920, 126]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 420, 181, 439]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 420, 495, 439]]<|/det|>
Express \(S_{n + 3}\) in terms of \(S_{n + 2}\) and \(S_{n}\) .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 415, 920, 434]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 655, 180, 672]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 655, 519, 672]]<|/det|>
Hence, or otherwise, find the value of \(S_{4}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 655, 920, 672]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 144, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 72, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
Use the substitution \(y = S_{1} - x\), where \(S_{1}\) is the numerical value found in part **(a)**, to find and simplify an equation whose roots are \(\alpha + \beta\), \(\beta + \gamma\), \(\gamma + \alpha\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 87, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 688, 185, 707]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 682, 479, 707]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(\frac{1}{\alpha + \beta} + \frac{1}{\beta + \gamma} + \frac{1}{\gamma + \alpha}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 682, 920, 701]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 97, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 660, 91]]<|/det|>
Prove by mathematical induction that, for all positive integers \(n\),

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[356, 104, 645, 149]]<|/det|>
\[\sum_{r = 1}^{n}\bigl (5r^{4} + r^{2}\bigr) = \textstyle {\frac{1}{2}}n^{2}(n + 1)^{2}(2n + 1). \quad [6]\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 84, 146, 103]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 75, 920, 128]]<|/det|>
Use the result given in part (a) together with the List of formulae (MF19) to find \(\sum_{r = 1}^{n} r^4\) in terms of \(n\), fully factorising your answer.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 108, 920, 127]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 94, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 416, 89]]<|/det|>
The matrices \(\mathbf{A}\), \(\mathbf{B}\) and \(\mathbf{C}\) are given by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[287, 98, 714, 153]]<|/det|>
\[\mathbf{A} = \begin{pmatrix} 2 & k & k \\ 5 & -1 & 3 \\ 1 & 0 & 1 \end{pmatrix}, \quad \mathbf{B} = \begin{pmatrix} 1 & 0 \\ 0 & 1 \\ 1 & 0 \end{pmatrix} \text{and} \quad \mathbf{C} = \begin{pmatrix} 0 & 1 & 1 \\ -1 & 2 & 0 \end{pmatrix},\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 163, 322, 181]]<|/det|>
where \(k\) is a real constant.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 195, 146, 212]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 195, 245, 212]]<|/det|>
Find CAB.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 196, 920, 214]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 567, 186, 585]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 567, 500, 585]]<|/det|>
Given that \(\mathbf{A}\) is singular, find the value of \(k\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 567, 920, 585]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 144, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 920, 104]]<|/det|>
Using the value of \(k\) from part **(b)**, find the equations of the invariant lines, through the origin, of the transformation in the \(x\)-\(y\) plane represented by **CAB**.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 84, 920, 102]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 78, 94, 98]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 640, 102]]<|/det|>
The curve \(C\) has polar equation \(r = \frac{1}{\pi - \theta} - \frac{1}{\pi}\), where \(0 \leqslant \theta \leqslant \frac{1}{2}\pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 109, 144, 128]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 109, 237, 128]]<|/det|>
Sketch \(C\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 109, 920, 128]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 512, 146, 530]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 508, 816, 533]]<|/det|>
Show that the area of the region bounded by the half-line \(\theta = \frac{1}{2}\pi\) and \(C\) is \(\frac{3 - 4\ln 2}{4\pi}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[875, 512, 905, 530]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
The lines \(l_{1}\) and \(l_{2}\) have equations \(\mathbf{r} = -\mathbf{i} - 2\mathbf{j} + \mathbf{k} + s(2\mathbf{i} - 3\mathbf{j})\) and \(\mathbf{r} = 3\mathbf{i} - 2\mathbf{k} + t(3\mathbf{i} - \mathbf{j} + 3\mathbf{k})\) respectively.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 119, 720, 140]]<|/det|>
The plane \(\Pi_{1}\) contains \(l_{1}\) and the point \(P\) with position vector \(-2\mathbf{i} - 2\mathbf{j} + 4\mathbf{k}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 151, 144, 170]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 150, 727, 170]]<|/det|>
Find an equation of \(\Pi_{1}\), giving your answer in the form \(\mathbf{r} = \mathbf{a} + \lambda \mathbf{b} + \mu \mathbf{c}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 151, 920, 170]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 400, 479, 420]]<|/det|>
The plane \(\Pi_{2}\) contains \(l_{2}\) and is parallel to \(l_{1}\) .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 429, 146, 448]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 428, 730, 448]]<|/det|>
Find an equation of \(\Pi_{2}\), giving your answer in the form \(ax + by + cz = d\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 429, 920, 448]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 144, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 487, 89]]<|/det|>
Find the acute angle between \(\varPi_{1}\) and \(\varPi_{2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 72, 918, 89]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 75, 144, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 73, 460, 96]]<|/det|>
The point \(Q\) is such that \(\overrightarrow{OQ} = -5\overrightarrow{OP}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 106, 781, 128]]<|/det|>
Find the position vector of the foot of the perpendicular from the point \(Q\) to \(\varPi_{2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 107, 920, 126]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 82, 94, 101]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 77, 443, 107]]<|/det|>
The curve \(C\) has equation \(y = \frac{x^{2} - x - 3}{1 + x - x^{2}}.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 112, 144, 131]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 112, 487, 131]]<|/det|>
Find the equations of the asymptotes of \(C\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 112, 918, 131]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 425, 186, 444]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 424, 551, 444]]<|/det|>
Find the coordinates of any stationary points on \(C\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 424, 920, 443]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 144, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 71, 678, 89]]<|/det|>
Sketch \(C\), stating the coordinates of the intersections with the axes.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 70, 920, 88]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 504, 144, 523]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 496, 920, 560]]<|/det|>
Sketch the curve with equation \(y = \left|\frac{x^{2} - x - 3}{1 + x - x^{2}}\right|\) and find in exact form the set of values of \(x\) for which \(\left|\frac{x^{2} - x - 3}{1 + x - x^{2}}\right| < 3.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 534, 920, 553]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[430, 72, 567, 89]]<|/det|>
